comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content:
"1 prop engine left OUT for clarity..."

Excellent rendering of the Douglas C-133; in the aircraft's cabin he appears to have depicted the powerplant layout for each engine nacelle, twin turbines yoked together through a common gearbox to drive the propeller...

comment.author: 77564621@N04
comment._content: Was this just a speculative piece, or was this a serious proposal for flight testing the GE X211?

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77564621@N04] I think it was closer to speculative than to serious...
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 77564621@N04
comment._content: Ah.  I see.  I was curious since this didn't look practical, but still seemed somewhat plausible.
